description.narrative: Output 4.2: By 2018, pregnant and lactating women and all caretakers of children, including fathers, have knowledge of and apply infant and young child feeding practices and other essential care practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.2: By 2018, pregnant and lactating women and all caretakers of children, including fathers, have knowledge of and apply infant and young child feeding practices and other essential care practices

description.narrative: Over 8,050 (43%) villages nationally acquired capacity to provide IYCF promotional and counselling services. The rollout of community IMCI services which integrated IYCF from the outset promises greater sustainability of IYCF results. The adopted IYCF strategy and operational plan are a further step forward to guide implementation at all levels. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019

title.narrative: Community health workers trained with UNICEF support to provide infant and young child feeding counselling services in the reporting year

Pourcentage de DS ayant au moins 50% des acteurs communautaires forms pour fournir des services de conseil en ANJE au cours des trois dernires annes

Existence of a national IYCF training curriculum for health and nutrition workers
Annual follow-up of violations of the international code of marketing of Breast-milk substitutes.
Country has a budgeted plan to eliminate water and fluids to support increase in exclusive breastfeeding
Country has a budgeted plan to improve dietary diversity
Adoption of the International Code on Marketing of Breastmilk substitutes as legislation and subsequent relevant World Health Assembly resolutions
